subject: Design
title: The QR Code: From Car Parts to Everything
description: A quick win: understand The QR Code: From Car Parts to Everything.

hook.text: QR codes were invented in 1994 to track car parts in Japanese factories. Now they're on every restaurant table.

buildup.text: Denso Wave engineer Masahiro Hara designed a 2D barcode that could store 350 times more data than a standard barcode.

discovery.text: Hara made QR codes open-source. That selfless decision enabled global adoption without licensing fees.

twist.text: QR codes were considered dead by 2015. COVID menus and contactless payments revived them overnight.

climax.text: A humble industrial tool became the bridge between physical and digital worlds.

punchline.text: The most useful design of the century was given away for free.

quiz.question: Why did QR codes achieve global adoption?
options: The inventor made them open-source, removing licensing barriers
